articles.author: Helen Coster, Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: When Lachlan Murdoch, the eldest son of media titan Rupert Murdoch, was named the sole chairman of News Corp (NWSA.O) and Fox Corp (FOXA.O) on Thursday, the announcement put to rest immediate questions about who will run a sprawling media empire that includes some of the most powerful brands in the world.
articles.title: Murdoch Family Trust: The real battle over succession has yet to begin

articles.author: Zeba Siddiqui, Raphael Satter
articles.description: About a year ago, the U.S. security firm Palo Alto Networks began to hear from a flurry of companies that had been hacked in ways that weren't the norm for cybercriminals.
articles.title: 'Power, influence, notoriety': The Gen-Z hackers who struck MGM, Caesars

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Commerce Department on Friday is issuing final rules to prevent semiconductor manufacturing subsidies from being used by China and other countries deemed to pose American national security concerns.
articles.title: US finalizes rules to prevent China from benefiting from $52 bln in chips funding

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A panel of advisers to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Friday will vote on the use of Pfizer's (PFE.N) respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) vaccine in pregnant women, likely paving the way for it to become the country's first maternal shot for protecting babies from the virus.
articles.title: US CDC panel weighs use of Pfizer's maternal RSV vaccine to protect infants

articles.author: Ankika Biswas, Shristi A
articles.description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq made a slight recovery on Friday as Treasury yields retreated from multi-year highs, while shares of Ford jumped on news of progress in labor talks with workers' union.
articles.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq rebound as Treasury yields retreat; Ford rises

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials warned on Friday of further rate hikes even after voting to hold the benchmark federal funds rate steady at a meeting this week, with two policymakers saying they remain unconvinced the inflation battle is finished.
articles.title: Fed officials flag further hikes even after holding steady

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve system is cutting about 300 people from its payroll this year, a small but rare reduction in headcount across an organization that has grown steadily since 2010 as its reach in the economy and regulatory agenda have expanded.
articles.title: Fed is cutting staff after more than a decade of payroll growth

articles.author: David Shepardson, Joseph White
articles.description: The United Auto Workers will expand its strikes against Detroit automakers General Motors (GM.N) and Chrysler parent Stellantis (STLAM.MI), but has made real progress in talks with Ford Motor (F.N), the union said on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: UAW to strike more GM, Stellantis plants, has made progress with Ford

articles.author: Makini Brice, Richard Cowan
articles.description: Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives on Friday turned to a new strategy in a long-shot bid to prevent the fourth government shutdown in a decade, as time runs short ahead of a Sept. 30 deadline.
articles.title: U.S. House Republicans try long-shot strategy to avoid shutdown

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, James Pearson
articles.description: Russian spies are using hackers to target computer systems at law enforcement agencies in Ukraine in a bid to identify and obtain evidence related to alleged Russian war crimes, Ukraine's cyber defence chief told Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russian hackers seek war crimes evidence, Ukraine cyber chief says
